long_story: Since 2017 I process satellite imagery and especially Sentinel-1 (Synthetic Aperture Radar) and Sentinel-2 (Optical Data). For the last one and a half years, I process Sentinel-5 TROPOMI (atmospheric data) and MODIS VIIRS satellite data. I’ve organized my code in R packages and applications and a sample of my work can be found in the following web link https://monopteryx.netlify.app/portfolio/

Event: Ranked 24th out of 3341 teams in the Kaggle Ship or Iceberg Challenge using deep learning
long_story: In January 2018 I participated in a geospatial challenge in the Kaggle competitive programming platform to predict whether an image contains a ship or an iceberg using Sentinel-1 Synthetic Aperture Radar imagery and using an ensemble of Keras deep learning models I ranked  24th out of 3.341 teams

Event: Ranked 9th out of 221 participants in the TopCoder Circle Finder Marathon Challenge using object detection
long_story: In October 2020 I participated in a geospatial challenge in the Topcoder competitive programming platform to identify all circles from the provided images as accurate as possible using an Artificial Intelligence model and using a Pytorch object detection algorithm I ranked 9th out of 221 Registrants. For the pre- and post-processing of the Data I used besides Python also geospatial R packages such as stars and raster

Event: Replicated the Segmentation of Satellite Imagery using U-Net Models for Land Cover Classification
long_story: I am also interested in Land Cover (Crop) multi-class classification tasks. I reproduced the paper, “Segmentation of Satellite Imagery using U-Net Models for Land Cover Classification” using various segmentation algorithms of the Keras framework. I performed the task by downloading and processing Sentinel-2 Analysis Ready Data and merged the data with the Corine 2018 Land cover masks.
